citeinfo.origin: Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education - geocoded by DHSS
citeinfo.title: schoolPublic

pubinfo.publish: Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

citeinfo.othercit:
Original data provided by Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education - http://www.dese.mo.gov/directory/download.html Originally geocoded using the Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS.
Some schools photo identified and placed by University of Missouri's Geographic Resource Center (GRC).
February 2010 from data published 11/25/2009

descript.purpose: Missouri schools. This layer currently includes public schools as provided by the Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education.
descript.supplinf:
Locations generated using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS from data provided by Missouri Dept of Elementary and Secondary Education from their web site (http://www.dese.mo.gov/directory/download.html)
Quality Control by Geographic Resources Center (GRC) completed 10/13/2003 to adjust for false Geocoding results. (Geocoding points that were originally accurate to the ZIP code centroid.)
PUBLIC SCHOOLS updated 5/2004. Locational updates provided by GEOGRAPHIC RESOURCE CENTER 6/24/2004
New schools for year 2004-2005 placed using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS.
5/9/2007 - schools closed since 2005-2006 were deleted. Schools new for 2006-2007 were added by geocoding addresses with Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Enrollment for these new schools is "0" at the time of data layer creation.
4/7/2008 - new schools for 2007-2008 school year added. Several corrections to locations made to GRC work done in 2003.
3/31/2009 - new schools for 2008-2009 added, any closed schools removed. Locations of new schools photo identified if possible.
2/5/2010 - new schools for 2009-2010 added, any closed schools removed. Location of new schools photo identified if possible.
NOTE: Charter schools, which had been previously stored as a separate layer for 2008-09 school year are now included in this public school layers.
10/2010: Data was field verified in the Southeast region of Missouri by staff in the SEMO and Bootheel Regional Planning Commission (RPC) offices, and corrections were added to this file by Missouri State Emergency Management Agency GIS staff. Data that has been field verified by these agencies has a value of "RPC" in the field "LocCode".

cntperp.cntorg: Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

horizpa.horizpar: Matched to Missouri 1 meter Digital Ortho Quarter Quadrangles - 2004

procstep.procdesc: Excel data provided by program converted to Access table
School IDs (SCHID) from previous year (2005-2006) was used to determine which facilities were closed and which facilities were newly opened.
Table of new addresses was geocoded using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS; personal geodatabase file created
Copy of 2006 public schools layer was created as a temp version.
Facilities that had closed since last data update were delete from temp file.
New addresses geocoded in previous step were appended to temp file.
Locations were checked against 2004 NAIP aerial photography to refine location
Personal geodatabase is exported to shape file.
Metadata for 2006 public schools layer is exported to text. Process steps are added.

Shape file is copied from temporary workspace into facility directory located at DHSS as M:\GISDATA\FAcility. Shape file from 2006 is renamed from schoolPub.shp to schoolPub06.shp. File for 2007 is given the name schoolPub.shp in its place.
Shape file is also copied into SDE for use in IMS sites.

XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2007-2008. New schools are put into a new file for processing.

Access table of new schools is geocoded using Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. All points are checked against 2006 aerial photography. (In the Eastern 1/2 of the state, the 2007 aerial photography is used.) Latitude and Longitude coordinates for corrected locations are added to table.
New latitude and longitude points are linked back to Access table of all schools. Points are displayed in ArcMap using Display XY command. Data is exported to shape file.

As a quality check, entire table is geocoded again. Fields for X and Y coordinates are added to this temporary file using the ArcMap command Calculate Geometry. Shape file from previous step also has these fields added. In Access, a table is created that contains the ID, school name and XY coordinates pairs for each. This resultant table is used to generate a line file using the Hawth's Tools command Add XY Line Data from Table. Length of these lines are calculated in miles using the ArcMap Calculate Geometry command. Schools that were more than 1 mile different (between original check at MU in 2004 and regeocoded locations) were verified. Several points were determined to be incorrect (often high school and junior high locations were reversed).

UPDATES FOR 2009 -XLS file from DESE web site is downloaded. File is imported into Microsoft Access. School ID is created by concatenating district number and school number. Fields are added for latitude/longitude and location code. Latitude and Longitude from previous year's layer is transferred to new file using Access update query. Locations that do not have lat/long field are new for 2008-2009. New schools are put into a new file for processing.

New facilities for 2009 (there were 29) were geocoded using the software Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on 2008 aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2009-2010 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name.

Metadata from 2008 was exported to text and updated for 2009. Metadata in text format was then imported back into the personal geodatabase. The personal geodatabase was then exported to shape file format. The shape file was copied to M:\GISDATA\Facility. (The previous year's layer was copied to M:\GISDATA|archiveFacility and renamed schoolPublic08.shp.

New facilities for 2009 were geocoded using the software Centrus Geocoder for ArcGIS. Positions were photo identified on 2007 aerial photography where possible (see loc_code attribute for level of positional placement). Latitude, Longitude and Loc_Code were copied and pasted into the missing fields in the working full table of 2008-2009 sites. Table was then displayed as XY events. Events were then exported to personal geodatabase. Spatial join to county boundaries was made to add a column for county name.

Metadata from 2009 was exported to text and updated for 2010. Metadata in text format was then imported back into the personal geodatabase. The personal geodatabase was then exported to shape file format. The shape file was copied to M:\GISDATA\Facility. (The previous year's layer was copied to M:\GISDATA|archiveFacility and renamed schoolPublic09.shp.
Metadata imported.
Metadata imported.
